about_the_game:
Brutal Bible Bloodbaths is a gory first-person physics-based game. It involves a few sandbox levels that you can play around in. These levels include things mentioned in the Bible passage, such as fruit trees that God says not to chop.

Cleanse the promised land

Based on Deuteronomy 20:16-18 from the Bible, you have to kill everything that breathes and you can order soldiers to help you. Your victims include animals, children, babies, and sexual worship assistants.

Fully dynamic chopping

Using your magic laser sword, you can chop people, animals, and many other objects however you like, as much as you like.

Precision chopping quest

An optional quest gets you to chop people and animals in specific ways such as chopping their leg, arm, or tail. When finished you can return to the box to see how obedient you were.

The Sinful Temple

In a level you can explore a temple containing things God hates like child sacrifice and sexual worship assistants. You can worship the god/goddess idols in the temple but this will cause the soldiers to target you as well.

Tidy up the bodies

A level has you tidying up the clutter in the promised land after cleansing by pushing chopped up bodies into a pit.

Chase and chop

In a level you have to chop people who are hiding and running for their lives and try to get a low enough cleansing time.

The Body Hacker

This weapon allows you to hack the matrix in the game to make the targeted body part break into pieces.

Holy Hand Grenades

Blow all of the people and animals to kingdom come in slow motion.

Other things in the game

You can also ride horses, get drunk on fermented fruit, build ladders to get over city walls, and chop just about everything including flowers and torches.

content_descriptors.notes: This cartoony game is based on a Bible passage telling you to kill everything that breathes in the promised land. You do this by chopping them up with your magic laser sword causing blood to spray everywhere. There are also sexual worship assistants who stand around in their underwear. The Bible passage says that God hates the way the people worship their gods.
